cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 255 mi ESE of Grand Turk Island and 140 mi NW of San Juan, Puerto Rico
cyclone.trajectory: continuing west-northwest, expected to turn northwest and then north, tracking through the Bahamas toward south Florida and then northward along/near the Florida Peninsula toward Georgia and South Carolina

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect along Georgia coast at this advisory
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect along Georgia coast at this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys northward along the entire Florida east coast, Georgia coast, and southern South Carolina
weather_observation.wind: 63% chance of sustained 34-kt winds; 31% chance of 50-kt winds late Sunday into Monday with higher gusts possible if the center tracks closer to the coast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Large wind field and onshore flow could drive 3–6 ft surge along the southeast Georgia coast, including Brunswick and surrounding tidal rivers.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain associated with Irma could produce 4–8 inches with localized higher totals, leading to flash flooding at and near the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents, possible tornadoes embedded in rain bands, and navigation restrictions as the Coast Guard raises port conditions.
